abstract: China, United States and Brazil report significant progress on environmental initiatives, positive sign as nations prepare for global summit meeting aimed at establishing agreement to cut greenhouse gas emissions; scientists say that efforts will still not be sufficient to stave off atmospheric temperature increase of 2 degrees Celsisus, level widely seen as tipping point for extreme storms, drought, resource shortages and rising sea levels.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and President Dilma Rousseff of Brazil pledged to increase the use of wind and solar power, and Brazil said it would restore nearly 30 million acres of Amazon rain forest.

headline.main: Global Climate Pact Gains Momentum as China, U.S. and Brazil Detail Plans
headline.print_headline: Global Climate Pact Gains Momentum as China, U.S. and Brazil Outline Plans

snippet: President Obama and President Dilma Rousseff of Brazil pledged to increase the use of wind and solar power, and Brazil said it would restore nearly 30 million acres of Amazon rain forest.
